info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Whiteside, northwestern Bureau and northeastern Henry Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Deer Grove to 8 miles southwest of Walnut to 6 miles northwest of Kewanee. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walnut, Wyanet, Atkinson, Sheffield, Annawan, Tampico, Buda, Hooppole, Deer Grove, Ohio, Neponset, Yorktown, Manlius, Mineral, New Bedford, Thomas, Providence, German Corner, Kasbeer, and Normandy. This includes Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 26 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
